title: 彭博: 眾議院將在星期三通過《香港人權與民主法案》新版本

replies.msg:
彭博: 眾議院已安排《香港人權與民主法案》新版本於星期三投票表決

http://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-20/mcconnell-says-trump-must-uphold-obligations-to-back-hong-kong?srnd=premium

House Plans Vote Backing Hong Kong, Defying China’s Warnings
By Daniel Flatley
November 20, 2019, 11:34 PM GMT+8 Updated on November 21, 2019, 1:24 AM GMT+8

The U.S. House plans to vote Wednesday on the Senate’s bill supporting Hong Kong protesters, escalating a confrontation with China at a crucial moment in trade talks and forcing President Donald Trump to decide whether to side with demonstrators over threats of retaliation from Beijing.

Speaker Nancy Pelosi will put the measure to a vote in the House of Representatives, according to a congressional aide. The Senate unanimously passed the legislation Tuesday, advancing the bill derided by China as a “gross” interference in Hong Kong affairs.

That gives Trump an urgent choice: Signing the bill into law risks imperiling the long-awaited trade agreement, while vetoing the measure -- which has overwhelming support in both chambers -- risks Congress overriding the president for the first time.

Remarkable bipartisan support for taking a tough stance with China creates one of the toughest economic and foreign policy challenges of Trump’s presidency. He desperately needs the China trade deal -- and the economic bump from resolving that uncertainty -- as he ramps up his campaign for re-election. But going against the will of Congress presents its own challenges as Trump faces impeachment in the House.

“I’m delighted” about the House’s scheduled vote, Senate Foreign Relations Chairman Jim Risch said in an interview. “I’m more than cautiously optimistic they’ll pass it.”

The House plans to vote on the Hong Kong measure using an expedited process that requires a two-thirds majority to pass, the aide said. The House unanimously approved a similar bill last month, but simply taking up the Senate version, S. 1838, would send the legislation to Trump’s desk immediately, without a delay to reconcile slight differences.
Trade Deal Risk

The Senate bill would require annual reviews of Hong Kong’s special status under U.S. law and sanction officials deemed responsible for human rights abuses and undermining the city’s autonomy.

“I certainly hope the House takes it up and passes it with the same overwhelmingly bipartisan margin we saw here in the Senate,” Senator Ted Cruz, a Republican from Texas, said in an interview. “The Communist party will not be allowed to crush Hong Kong under its boot.”

The White House on Wednesday declined to comment on the legislation.

Trump has been virtually silent on the Hong Kong protests that escalated into violence in recent weeks, even as Republicans demanded action on the measure. Chinese officials quickly responded to the bill’s Senate passage Tuesday, saying Beijing “firmly” opposes the measure it considers a grave violation of international law.

Ma Zhaoxu, the Chinese vice minister of foreign affairs, summoned William Klein, a U.S. embassy official, and raised strong objections to the bill. Separately, Hong Kong’s government expressed “extreme regret” about the measure and said the legislation would negatively impact relations with the U.S.

China’s retaliation since Trump kicked off a trade war last year has mostly been tit-for-tat tariffs, always saying that it was left with no other choice. In other areas where it’s been hit by the U.S. -- Taiwan arms sales, sanctions over human-rights abuses in the far west region of Xinjiang, putting Huawei Technologies Co. on a blacklist -- China has held fire despite threats to hit back.

“It’s worth noting that the U.S. can do more damage to China than China can do to the U.S.,” said Shi Yinhong, an adviser to China’s cabinet who is a professor of international relations at Renmin University in Beijing.

Holding China Accountable

Still, Trump faces political risk heading into 2020 if conflict with China scuttles trade negotiations. The president’s main pitch to voters has been the strong U.S. economy and his ability to strike deals that put “America first,” as he often says.

“The imminent retaliation from China would be on the on-going trade talks,” said Huiyao Wang, another adviser to China’s cabinet and founder of the Center for China and Globalization in Beijing. “The Hong Kong bill will do tremendous damage to the prospect of a trade deal and stall the negotiation process as China’s side won’t engage positively with U.S. counterparts.”

Vice President Mike Pence has had the harshest words for China recently on behalf of the U.S. administration. He said on Tuesday that it would be tough for the U.S. to sign a trade agreement with China if the demonstrations in Hong Kong are met with violence.

Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell on Wednesday called on Trump and U.S. allies to “fulfill their roles” supporting Hong Kong protesters and enforcing China’s agreements to respect the city’s freedoms.

“I am proud that senators approved these further steps to update that original law to preserve Hong Kong’s autonomy and democracy and provide more tools for holding Beijing accountable,” McConnell, a Kentucky Republican, said on the Senate floor. “While this bill moves forward, it is also important for the executive branch and our allies and partners around the world to fulfill their roles as well.”

— With assistance by Iain Marlow, and Dandan Li
(Updates with lawmaker quotes and China details beginning in the fifth paragraph.)

蘋果日報列出兩者分別。
https://hk.news.appledaily.com/local/realtime/article/20190926/60086587
兩院《法案》比較
●對示威者申請美國簽證可「特事特辦」的政策
眾議院：沒有特定時間性
參議院：列明是2014年或之後居港人士不會因遭政治因素被檢控、拘留而被美國拒絕發出簽證；同時列明國務卿需與其他國家合作，鼓勵推動相關政策
●針對打壓香港自由及自治的制裁機制
眾議院：有三大條件，包括1﹚迫供、酷刑、違法拘留；2﹚一再違反《中英聯合聲明》及《基本法》；3﹚嚴重違反國際人權公約
參議院：只有兩大條件，包括迫供、酷刑、違法拘留，以及嚴重違反國際人權公約
●制裁手段
眾議院：凍結資產及拒絕簽證申請，後者對象擴闊到涉事人的直屬親屬
參議院：凍結資產及拒絕簽證申請，但僅包括觸犯制裁機制條件的人士
●定期檢視美國技術會否被中國用作發展社會信用系統
眾議院：由總統提交寫報告
參議院：由商務部經諮詢財務部及國務卿後提交

兩者最大分別就係眾議院版本有大家最鐘意嘅連坐法，呢個係眾議院版本比參議院版本優勝嘅地方。
而參議院版本優勝嘅地方就係，佢特別有提及支持2020普選

蘋果日報列出兩者分別。
https://hk.news.appledaily.com/local/realtime/article/20190926/60086587
兩院《法案》比較
●對示威者申請美國簽證可「特事特辦」的政策
眾議院：沒有特定時間性
參議院：列明是2014年或之後居港人士不會因遭政治因素被檢控、拘留而被美國拒絕發出簽證；同時列明國務卿需與其他國家合作，鼓勵推動相關政策
●針對打壓香港自由及自治的制裁機制
眾議院：有三大條件，包括1﹚迫供、酷刑、違法拘留；2﹚一再違反《中英聯合聲明》及《基本法》；3﹚嚴重違反國際人權公約
參議院：只有兩大條件，包括迫供、酷刑、違法拘留，以及嚴重違反國際人權公約
●制裁手段
眾議院：凍結資產及拒絕簽證申請，後者對象擴闊到涉事人的直屬親屬
參議院：凍結資產及拒絕簽證申請，但僅包括觸犯制裁機制條件的人士
●定期檢視美國技術會否被中國用作發展社會信用系統
眾議院：由總統提交寫報告
參議院：由商務部經諮詢財務部及國務卿後提交

兩者最大分別就係眾議院版本有大家最鐘意嘅連坐法，呢個係眾議院版本比參議院版本優勝嘅地方。
而參議院版本優勝嘅地方就係，佢特別有提及支持2020普選

quote.msg:
https://lihkg.com/thread/1741148/page/1

蘋果日報列出兩者分別。
https://hk.news.appledaily.com/local/realtime/article/20190926/60086587
兩院《法案》比較
●對示威者申請美國簽證可「特事特辦」的政策
眾議院：沒有特定時間性
參議院：列明是2014年或之後居港人士不會因遭政治因素被檢控、拘留而被美國拒絕發出簽證；同時列明國務卿需與其他國家合作，鼓勵推動相關政策
●針對打壓香港自由及自治的制裁機制
眾議院：有三大條件，包括1﹚迫供、酷刑、違法拘留；2﹚一再違反《中英聯合聲明》及《基本法》；3﹚嚴重違反國際人權公約
參議院：只有兩大條件，包括迫供、酷刑、違法拘留，以及嚴重違反國際人權公約
●制裁手段
眾議院：凍結資產及拒絕簽證申請，後者對象擴闊到涉事人的直屬親屬
參議院：凍結資產及拒絕簽證申請，但僅包括觸犯制裁機制條件的人士
●定期檢視美國技術會否被中國用作發展社會信用系統
眾議院：由總統提交寫報告
參議院：由商務部經諮詢財務部及國務卿後提交

兩者最大分別就係眾議院版本有大家最鐘意嘅連坐法，呢個係眾議院版本比參議院版本優勝嘅地方。
而參議院版本優勝嘅地方就係，佢特別有提及支持2020普選

好多人只係識j連坐法架咋
其他細節唔會理/唔識
參議院版本有吹雞叫盟友呢項

replies.msg:
我今日先有時間詳細比較，除左上面，仲有幾個重點，有好有唔好。

好嘅有
1、對於香港人申請美國簽證，眾議院版受惠要係 Visa denied 唯一 solely 「因為參與示威活動」而被捕，扣留，或定罪D人。但參議院版就主要 visa denied primarily，又冇左「因為參與示威活動」。條件寬好多。
2、好幾道都話到要聯繫各盟國，做同樣嘅嘢。
3、寫明要雙普選，2020 立法會全直選等。
4、制裁，之前條唔包綠卡，而家有綠卡都會制裁

但唔好嘅係

5、以上2同3都衹係 policy 政策，唔係法定，冇約束力。
6、制裁除左冇包親戚之外，仲有日落條款，5年自動消失
7、軍用出口管制果D，呢到捂太關心癈事講，但呢條都條 reporting requirement 7年消失。

個人想法，等唔切啦，唯有袋住先，但要打長線就要好似台灣咁，建立長期有力游說架構。最重要個 part 5年日落，所以要2至3年內架構成熟有效，唔係冇左由頭來過可能二、三十年。

RTHK即時新聞
謝鋒召見美駐港總領事反對美參議院通過人權民主法案

外交部駐港特派員謝鋒召見美國駐港總領事史墨客，就美國國會參議院通過「香港人權與民主法案」，提出強烈抗議及堅決反對。謝鋒表示，法案是與750萬香港市民及14億中國人民作對，批評美國政客與暴徒站在同一邊，公然與香港反對派及極端暴力分子內外勾結，企圖打香港牌來要挾中國政府，是白日做夢，強調中國政府堅定不移維護國家主權安全與發展，堅定不移貫徹一國兩制方針，反對任何外部勢力干涉香港事務。謝鋒奉勸美方不要打錯算盤，敦促行政當局認清法案的嚴重危害，不支持、不簽署，停止插手香港事務，如果一意孤行，中方必將採取堅決反制措施，美方將自食惡果。

quote.msg: 唔係減左好多 而係兩邊個版本都有大家冇既野

我今日先有時間詳細比較，除左上面，仲有幾個重點，有好有唔好。

好嘅有
1、對於香港人申請美國簽證，眾議院版受惠要係 Visa denied 唯一 solely 「因為參與示威活動」而被捕，扣留，或定罪D人。但參議院版就主要 visa denied primarily，又冇左「因為參與示威活動」。條件寬好多。
2、好幾道都話到要聯繫各盟國，做同樣嘅嘢。
3、寫明要雙普選，2020 立法會全直選等。
4、制裁，之前條唔包綠卡，而家有綠卡都會制裁

但唔好嘅係

5、以上2同3都衹係 policy 政策，唔係法定，冇約束力。
6、制裁除左冇包親戚之外，仲有日落條款，5年自動消失
7、軍用出口管制果D，呢到捂太關心癈事講，但呢條都條 reporting requirement 7年消失。

個人想法，等唔切啦，唯有袋住先，但要打長線就要好似台灣咁，建立長期有力游說架構。最重要個 part 5年日落，所以要2至3年內架構成熟有效，唔係冇左由頭來過可能二、三十年。

quote.msg:
我今日先有時間詳細比較，除左上面，仲有幾個重點，有好有唔好。

好嘅有
1、對於香港人申請美國簽證，眾議院版受惠要係 Visa denied 唯一 solely 「因為參與示威活動」而被捕，扣留，或定罪D人。但參議院版就主要 visa denied primarily，又冇左「因為參與示威活動」。條件寬好多。
2、好幾道都話到要聯繫各盟國，做同樣嘅嘢。
3、寫明要雙普選，2020 立法會全直選等。
4、制裁，之前條唔包綠卡，而家有綠卡都會制裁

但唔好嘅係

5、以上2同3都衹係 policy 政策，唔係法定，冇約束力。
6、制裁除左冇包親戚之外，仲有日落條款，5年自動消失
7、軍用出口管制果D，呢到捂太關心癈事講，但呢條都條 reporting requirement 7年消失。

個人想法，等唔切啦，唯有袋住先，但要打長線就要好似台灣咁，建立長期有力游說架構。最重要個 part 5年日落，所以要2至3年內架構成熟有效，唔係冇左由頭來過可能二、三十年。
搞唔到屋企人就真係，不過都好
好過冇，要快就冇辣。

桑德蘭承認特朗普指示安排美烏元首會面換查拜登父子

美國國會眾議院繼續舉行對總統特朗普的彈劾調查聽證會，美國駐歐盟大使桑德蘭推翻早前表示自己不知情的說法，承認在總統特朗普指令下，安排烏克蘭總統澤連斯基到白宮與特朗普會面，是有交換條件，就是烏克蘭要向前副總統拜登父子展開調查。桑德蘭說，國務卿蓬佩奧、署理白宮幕僚長馬爾瓦尼，以及國家安全委員會的高層領導，都知道這項計劃，國務院亦全力支持計劃。他與蓬佩奧溝通後，覺得自己可以告知烏克蘭當局，如果不承諾調查拜登父子，美國亦不會解凍向烏克蘭的軍事援助。特朗普強調，無向烏克蘭提供任何好處，又說曾經告知桑德蘭，不想與烏克蘭的交往，有任何交換條件。

Yea and Nay Vote. A vote in which members usually respond "aye" or "no" (despite the official title of the vote) on a question when their names are called in alphabetical order. Article I, Section 5 of the Constitution declares that "the Yeas and Nays of the Members...on any question" shall be obtained "at the Desire of one fifth of those present." Clause 6(a) of Rule XX provides that a yea and nay vote can be ordered "automatically" in the House when a Member objects to a pending vote on the ground that a quorum is not present. Yea and nay votes are usually taken by electronic device.

replies.msg:
Postponement of Votes. Under clause 8(a)(1) of Rule XX, the Speaker has the discretion to postpone votes for up to two legislative days on a number of questions. Other questions which can be postponed by the Speaker include adoption of resolutions and ordering the previous question on: (1) the adoption of a resolution; (2) the question of final passage of a bill; (3) the adoption of a motion to suspend the rules; (4) the question of instructing conferees; (5) the question of agreeing to a conference report; and, (6) votes on amendments or motions to recommit Corrections Calendar bills. The special rule governing consideration of a bill in the Committee of the Whole often provides that the Chair may postpone votes on amendments.

講完之後會一次過投票兩條BILL

Yea and Nay Vote
Yay and nay votes provide a record of how each Member voted. These votes are taken by electronic device unless the computerized voting system malfunctions, in which case standby
procedures outlined in Rule XX, clause 2(b), are used to conduct the votes.
The Constitution (Article I, Section 5) states that “the Yeas and Nays of the Members ... on any
question” shall be obtained “at the Desire of one fifth of those present.” Under this provision, it
does not matter if a quorum of the House (218 Members when the House has no vacancies) is not
present to conduct business, because any Member can say, “Mr. [or Madam] Speaker, on that
vote, I demand the yeas and nays.” If the demand is supported by one-fifth of those present, the
Speaker will say that “the yeas and nays” are ordered.
Rule XX, clause 6, provides another type of yea and nay vote. If it is evident to a lawmaker that a
quorum is not present in the chamber, he or she may object to a voice vote on that ground.
Assuming the chair sustains the point of order, the chair will order a yea and nay vote. To make a
quorum point of order, a Member says, “I object to the vote on the ground that a quorum is not
present, and I make a point of order that a quorum is not present.” The actual vote will then
simultaneously determine both issues: the presence of a quorum and the vote on the pending
question.
House Voting Procedures: Forms and Requirements
Congressional Research Service 98-228 · VERSION 14 · UPDATED 2
In addition, clause 10 of Rule XX states that the “yeas and nays shall be considered as ordered”
on final passage of a limited number of measures or matters, such as concurrent budget
resolutions. The Constitution requires that votes to override presidential vetoes shall be
determined by the yeas and nays.

replies.msg: 中大理大手足

Brother and Sisters don't forget why we started this whole movement. It was about the 5 demands. One of them is real true elections ( 真普選).

The house bill 連座 section that punish direct family members is more about punishment...

The Senate version actually mentions 2020 real elections. This is more supportive of our goal. I will rather have real election than punishment of wife and "innocent" children of Bad government officials.

The senate version also put effort to actively persuade other countries to help Hong Kong which I think is wonderful addition.

Finally, we have over 4000+ people arrested so far. Many of them our brothers and sisters. Many will get jail time 冇良民證 and possible 前途盡毀。The Senate bill will allow US departments to ignore jail time of brothers and sisters from 2014 onwards. So after jail, you can still go to USA for university, work or immigrate or return to Hong Kong (hopefully already 光復). This provides more hope for the future of our jailed brothers and sisters.

We cannot abandon our brothers and sisters for more revenge punishment on bad officials wife/husband and children.

分析指，特朗普的決定將出現三種可能局面。首先，如特朗普否決法案，他需提出理據，讓法案回歸國會審理，如最後在參眾兩院也得到三分二議員投票贊成，法案便會自動成為法律。第二，如果國會不休會，特朗普在十日內既不簽署亦不反對，法案便會自動成為法律。第三，如果特朗普在十日內不簽署，而國會休會，法案便會失效。

熟悉美國國情人士表示，由於《香港人權與民主法案》並非以實名方式以三分二大比數通過，特朗普有權不簽署並否決法案，雖然目前兩院在無異議下通過法案，即使特朗普否決法案，將法案發還兩院，兩院都有可能大比數通過法案，推翻特朗普決定，讓法案直接成為法律，但所需審議時間較長，並佔用兩院大會本來緊湊的審議時間

點解我憎 Trump?

https://hk.news.appledaily.com/international/realtime/article/20191121/60288642

美國參眾兩院已通過《香港人權與民主法案》（以下簡稱《人權法案》），然而約翰霍普金斯大學（Johns Hopkins University）的中國問題專家認為，特朗普喜歡親近專制領袖，並從他們身上榨取好處，無視中國國家主席習近平扼殺香港，所以美國國會是時候要做實事，而不是擺出《人權法案》這隻無牙老虎，只顧自我感覺良好。

該校中國研究主任兼教授梅爾塔（Andrew Mertha）在《國會山莊報》撰寫評論文章，指特朗普喜歡親近的專制領袖，都繼承了一些有價值的東西，讓他可以從中榨取好處，例如土耳其總統埃爾多安粉碎了世俗民主、俄羅斯總統普京將俄羅斯轉化為寡頭統治，還有現在的習近平，想將香港從政治經濟充滿獨特活力的社會，變成中國東南沿海的附庸城市。

梅爾塔說所以也難怪特朗普容許香港情況在他任期內發生，並指他似乎完全看不出習近平扼殺香港自由是有甚麼憲法問題，又形容這種盲點就如過往華府不擇手段以權謀算計，冷酷地對1956年的匈牙利人和1991年的庫爾德人置之不理。這連串的事件應能讓台灣人完全覺醒，明白到北京願意和有能力做到甚麼地步，以及台灣領導人預計能從無情的美國得到多少支持。
